metadata.title: CVE-2023-1118 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw use after free in the Linux kernel integrated infraredreceiver/transceiver driver was found in the way user detaching rc device.A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentiallyescalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic-64k - 5.15.0-72.79
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-42-generic - 5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-72.79').
